ratings.comment: Just finished my final for philosophy and I really loved the class. Professor Sidelle was so sweet and very funny at times. He likes participation and knows the names of everyone who goes to the in class lectures and raises their hand. It was a very interesting subject and he could go off on tangents but it just shows how much he loves it.

there is literally 6 things in the gradebook for this class. 2 exams, 2 quizzes, and 2 paper. If you do bad on one, you basically drop a grade level. The lectures are boring and honestly don't even help unless you are Einstein and have a background in Philo. take at own risk xxx

Nice guy, clear he loves the subject, but a lot of the time his lectures weren't very clear. I had a great TA to help me understand the topics, and it helped to read the textbook, but the lectures didn't help much at all. Very easy grader though.

Prof. Sidelle is awesome!  I really didn't read the book that much, and I still understood all of the concepts as he covers all important points in his lectures.  He really likes it when students participate, so raise your hand in lecture; he is a very open minded and nice guy.  Tests are really not bad, but they are mostly in  short essay form.

Professor Sidelle is great. He obviously loves teaching, and even makes an effort to learn student's names in lecture (if you participate.) He tends to ramble, but he reiterates important points enough that you can get away with dozing off a bit. Interesting and fairly easy class overall.

The class is rather difficult, but it is not by any means Professor Sidelle's fault. I started by not really reading any of the papers (something you can easily get away with in most philosophy classes), and found myself falling behind in the class. However, the material is extremely interesting (mindblowing, really), and Sidelle is great.

Alan is a cool guy who clearly loves the topic, however he tends to ramble on and on, so if you don't pay attention the whole time it can be easy to lose track of where he is. Not tough when it comes to grading, and the course load is fairly light. Overall it was a cool and interesting course.
This is my favorite class and by far my favorite professor that i have had at UW!

Sidelle is an incredible instructor.  His class is hilarious, and he really is an incredibly intelligent person.  I do not exactly understand what people are saying about reciprocating his lectures in order to receive a good grade, because being precise is possibly the most important aspect of philosophy.  He teaches you to be extremely clear.

Sidelle is an above average instructor. He explains things well, but takes forever to do so. Because of his lengthy rambles, it was hard to pay attention for entire lectures. Exams were pretty straight-forward. The workload was quite small for a 4 credit class. Only 2 (1-2 page) papers. DON'T BUY THE TEXTBOOK. ONLY BUY THE COURSE PACKET.

Funny, energetic professor. Tends to ramble on about one particular topic, and therefore gets behind on syllabus. Grades essays and exams based on EXACTLY what he says in lecture. Book reading could be tedious and unhelpful since he would clearly explain it in lecture. "Okay" class.

Professor Sidelle is super nice.  reading these other comments is sad because their dislike, I am sure, is due to more them not understanding the material than him being a bad teacher.  The content of 560 is difficult, but it is a very interesting class and sidelle is a great prof and great guy overall.
I hate PHILOS 101 but not because of Sidelle.  He is a good professor, I just regret taking a philosophy class in the first place.
This course is very interesting and not hard to gain a good grade. Just got an A. And I am an international student, I took this class in the first semester studying in a English language country.

Lectures mostly consist of him talking to the class. He's very friendly and approachable, but rambles quite a bit. Grade consists of one midterm, a final, 2 quizzes, and two papers, all of which are graded specifically, but its easy to earn an A if you pay attention in class. Don't buy the texbook, you really only need the course packet.
Very intelligent.
Language and Meaning, Fall 2010. Very knowledgeable and helpful. He could be a bit confusing, but the topics were difficult.

I can't help but wonder if I had the same prof. as a few of the other people who commented here. I greatly enjoyed Sidelle's class. I thought he was an eloquent, enthusiastic, and above all very kind teacher, very approachable and always willing to help. I also found the exams and both papers VERY reasonable. Highly recommended.

Alan is a nice quirky guy. He is a little awkward. But, his lectures are so out-there that i never know whats going on, which makes them boring. He likes to use big words that make him sound smart, and on top of how confusing he is makes lecture incomprehensible. do not take this class unless you are a VERY abstract thinker.

Sidelle is extremely boring, very monotonous and grades everything as if you are a philosophy expert. The class is not worth taking, especially with him as the prof. Very nice guy, but awful awful awful teacher. Avoid this class at all costs if you don't want to pull your hair out

Sidelle's lectures were terrible, and his grading even worse. Exams were near impossible, multiple choice was made of trick questions - he even admitted it, and 4 excessively detailed essays in 60 minutes? BARELY any graded material-2 writing assignments, final and midterm, and two 10 point quizzes. Sidelle ruined philosophy for me, and many others

Sidelle rambles more than anyone I know, and we got REALLY behind on the syllabus. Boring! But the class was easy, and he was very thorough and clear. If you pay attention in lecture at all you should be fine. Don't bother buying the textbook, you'll only need the coursepack. There are 2 papers, 2 quizzes, a midterm, and a final.

Excellent professor. He makes things very easy to understand. Even though the readings are sometimes dense, they are short, and he clarifies them perfectly. Very reasonable expectations for a 101 class, very helpful overall - take this class if you are interested in philo.

Sidelle is crystal clear, although lecture topics are a bit random. Can't imagine how anyone besides first semester freshmen would consider this class hard. It's an easy A--and pretty interesting most of the time.

Absolutely excellent class!  Professor Sidelle is extremely knowledgeable and spends a good amount of time on each topic to make sure you understand the arguments; he doesn't just rush through to cover everything, he wants you to know it.  He is also more than willing to help if you have questions. The most important readings are his notes/ packet.

Absolutely excellent class!  Professor Sidelle is extremely knowledgeable and spends a good amount of time on each topic to make sure you understand the arguments; he doesn't just rush through to cover everything, he wants you to know it.  He is also more than willing to help if you have questions. The most important readings are his notes/ packet.

Sidelle is extremely knowledgeable.  I personally am not very interested in philosophy, but it wasn't too bad with him.  Also I've talked to ppl who took it with other professors and their classes sounded way worse.  I wouldn't recommend philo 101, but if you do take it Sidelle is probably a good person to take it with.

Worst class ever. I was really looking forward to taking philosophy and he totally ruined it! He would ramble on about random topics, say we wouldn't need to know them, then put them on tests and quizzes. Midterms? "You have 75 mins to write 4 ESSAYS and answer a multiple choice section." Who can accomplish that in detail in 75 mins?

Sidelle is a great professor. He is extremely intelligent, with a response to the most difficult question immediately at hand. He is really nice (brought donuts to our final), and really good at walking you through the subject. He is a tough(ish) grader (at least for 560), but definitely fair. Highly recommend this guy.
Sidelle is a strong communicator.  Exams are straightforward and the class is fascinating.  Sidelle is very knowledgeable about he subject and is extremely helpful in office hours.  Take this class!
Not helpful, Harsh Grader, though material is interesting. Would not recommend this class. Take philosophy just not with Sidelle.

The class is pretty interesting, though often redundant. His tests aren't that difficult, but he is a REALLY picky grader. He basically wants you to repeat his lecture notes verbatim, so attending lecture is pretty necessary. It's clear, though, that he is very passionate about what he does, and because of that, the class is interesting.
The guy is really, really dull in class and if you deviate even slightly from exactly what he says he will knock you significantly. Office hours don't help. I would avoid him.

Good class, overall.  Grading on exams was pretty rought but that was mostly due to the TA's fault.  TA grades more difficult than the professor.  Nice man, that goes at a slow pace in order to allow students to understand the key points.  Read the course packet -- it's VERY helpful!

At first I really thought he talked too much and had a hard time being clear with his thoughts. Then one day I decided to read his course packet (GOOD IDEA!!) and understood just how smart he is. He knows so much it's ridiculous. Take this class it's quite interesting-just don't expect to be able to skip lectures, his tests are word for word!

I found this class extremely interesting. However, it's important to take very detailed notes. You need to know things almost word-for-word on exams. If you pay attention and know your notes, you should do fine. Sidelle is incredibly intelligent and entertaining, but it's easy to get bored if philosophy doesn't interest you.

Lectures were very repetitive. He got about 10 lectures behind the syllabus, because he hammered the concepts in. But you must give him credit for being thorough. His class is pretty easy, though the TA's can grade how they please.

Lectures are monotonous, he talks on subject to death and as you are walking out the door tries to start a new topic.  he is bearable. but even with the repetition the exam essay questions are confusing and took a while to interpret.

He is a good teacher. Sometimes he may struggle to find the words for an example, but that is because he doesn't use notes. He starts each class writing the intended topics on the board and proceeds to present them. He engages the class occasionally for questions. I found it better to listen than write what he writes on the board. Mandatory Disc.

He's a very good professor. He goes everything step by step. The only thing that may be difficult is trying to think in a philosophical sort of way. But if you read the book and go to lecture and discussion, you should do well. There are only 2 papers and 2 quizes with a midterm and a final so everything counts. Make sure to get help when needed.

Alan is a really cool guy! he has a sense of humor which is always nice! he loves teaching and it is obvious, and he also loves philosophy which makes his class great. He has a tendency to go over things and talk them to death, but that may work to your advantage for papers and essay questions on exams. Take his class!

It is true that he expects you to know allllll the points of every boring argument he teaches if you want to do well in the class.  I was kind of disappointed we didn't get to do more "free thinking".  He overexplains concepts, which makes lecture very boring and easily skipped. Nice guy, though.
I love this class. prof Sidelle is my favorite. I recommend him strongly.
Awesome course, and hilarious prof.

Easiest class I've ever taken.  Sidelle is approachable but very knowledgeable. I tried to debate him numerous times, but he is always ready to back up everything he teaches.  Take his class if you are looking for a fun philosopy course.
easy class, never really went to lecture

definately had to say exactly what he was thinking on your exams.  just remember to QUESTION EVERYTHING and you'll do ok.  didn't really need to go to class if you had his course packet but it helped a little. i had a crappy TA though so that can cause a problem
A very nice and friendly and intelligent person.

I don't know what people are talking about. Was the worst class I've ever taken. VERY boring. Papers and exams...you had to say exactly what he thought otherwise you got a bad grade. Had to memorize EVERYTHING. And my TA sucked too.
Gave clear explanations of everything.  He went a little slow, which made it ok to skip about 1/3 the classes and be on top of stuff.
Nice helpful guy, but if you dont put EXACTLY what he says in class you get points off.  Difficult class on simple material. Rambles too. AVOID THE POWERLECTURE.
clear about what we should know, lectures are generally easy to follow and very useful, not much outside work...If you take philosophy, I definitely recommend Sidelle.
